net.cloud.gfx.interfaces

Class InterfaceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.interfaces.InterfaceFactory

  • public class InterfaceFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory class for interfaces that are fairly simple, and not justifiably their own class. So, it's just a location for some code snippets as compared to creating a class for each snippet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InterfaceFactory

        public InterfaceFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • createStatOverlay

        public static Interface createStatOverlay(int width,
                                          int height)
        Creates an interface which will show various system statistics. It will be an overlay - essentially no background and no dimensions so that it will not hide the elements under it and will not consume any input events.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the interface this will be in - for positioning
        height - The height of the interface this will be in - for positioning
        Returns:
        An Interface which can be added to some Container... maybe the root...

      • createUpdateFpsFunction

        private static java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> createUpdateFpsFunction()
        Create a Function object which will supply a string for the FPS statistics label. The function will only create a new String object if need be, preferring to re-use the existing String if it's the same. I think an anonymous inner class may be the best solution, lambdas won't work since I need to store the previous value and modify it.
        Returns:
        A Function supplying an updated FPS string
